blog.name: tifit-tips
blog.title: TiFit Tips
blog.description: Want to be FIT on a budget? Follow us for budget-friendly health and fitness tips for college students! Let's be #TIPIDperoFIT

summary: Health and Fitness YouTube channels to Follow (for a Healthier College Life!)
title: Health and Fitness YouTube channels to Follow (for a Healthier College Life!)
body:
Trying to stay healthy while in college can be hard to do alone. You might not know what to do next. Fear not, here are some YouTube channels and vloggers you can follow to help you lead a healthier college life!

1. Tasty - You might already know Tasty. Our favorite food channel from Buzzfeed features tons of recipe videos and there’s sure to be one video for everyone’s taste–college students included. ;) Check out their 5 Meal-Prep Recipes here: 

2. Brothers Green Eats - Josh and Mike Greenfield focus on “good vibes, cheap eats, and delicious times.” They make a lot of videos about beginner-friendly and budget-friendly food that college students can have fun making! Check out their video on How to Eat Incredibly Well on $3 (150 pesos) a Day:

3. Mind Over Munch - Alyssia Sheikh is famous for her healthy and delicious meal prep videos. She gives tons of insights and tips on how to snack healthier, how to cook under a buget, and how to make healthy and easy bento boxes! Check out her Back to School Healthy Bento Box Lunches (No Cook) here. 

4. Healthy Grocery Girl - Megan Roosevelt is a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist. Her videos focus a lot of making heathy and easy videos perfect for busy people, like us college students. Check out her 3 Easy + Healthy Snack Ideas For Busy + On The Go! here.

5. Madeleine Shaw - Madeleine is a nutritional health coach and yoga teacher. You can find lots of tips on how to make easy, yummy, but healthy recipes in her videos. She also posts yoga and meditation videos for destressing and living healthier lifestyles. Check out her 5 Tips to Eating Healthy on a Budget here: 

6. Blogilates - Cassey Ho is a famous health and fitness YouTuber. You may know her for her many exercise instruction videos and healthy meal ideas. You can find a variety of exercise examples to work on at home or at the dorm in her channel, but never forget to warm-up first! Check out her Apartment Friendly Warmup video here:

7. Carly Rowena - Carly is a personal trainer and also a health and fitness blogger. She makes videos on a variety of health topics–from meal preps, workout routines, general fitness tips, and more! Check out her Beginner’s Guide to Getting Fit video here.

8. The Live Fit Girl - Deanna is a pilates instructor and she also features a variety of workout videos in her channel. Many of her exercise videos are apartment or dorm-friendly so you can definitely find a workout routine you can follow! Check out her Chair Workout for the Legs video here.

9. Yoga with Adriene - Like Cassey Ho, Adriene is also a famous fitness YouTuber. Her channel is filled with Yoga instruction videos to help you with leading a healthier life. If you’re interested in starting yoga, follow her Yoga For Complete Beginners - 20 Minutes Home Yoga Workout here!

10. Katie Horan - Katie mainly vlogs about college life that students can surely relate to. She often talks about her experience with classes, exams, and other college affairs in her “Day in my Life” videos. She also shares insights on how she stays healthy and gives ideas on what to buy and cook. Check out her Back to School Healthy Lunch Ideas here! 

Bonus! Other YouTubers who can help you through college life:
Mariana’s Study Corner - Mariana is a Portugese YouTuber. She gives a lot of tips and advice on how to organize and study for school or college. Students are sure to find a tip or two that can help them through their acads! Check out her video on How to Study Smarter, not Harder here.

Kati Morton - Kati Morton is a licensed therapist. She makes videos that tackle a variety of mental health topics. You can check out her channel if you want to know more about mental health disorders, how to cope with them, and more! After all, there’s no health without mental health. Check out her video on The 25 Coping Skills Everyone Must Have here.

summary: HCSM News ~ Janes Pub Style Chicken Burgers recalled due to possible salmonella contamination
title: HCSM News ~ Janes Pub Style Chicken Burgers recalled due to possible salmonella contamination
body:
Janes brand Pub Style Chicken Burgers have been recalled from the marketplace because of possible salmonella contamination, says the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/prince-edward-island/pei-janes-chicken-recall-1.4881190?cmp=rss

summary: Can't seem to find a way to flex tricep? Soft Lateral Head. via /r/Fitness
title: Can't seem to find a way to flex tricep? Soft Lateral Head. via /r/Fitness
body:
I can’t flex tricep or at least when I fully extend my arms the lateral head is pretty much soft. But for example if I do push ups or any exercise then every tricep head of mine is hard flexed of course. My tricep isn’t that well defined yet either but my left one definitely looks different than the right one.



Submitted October 27, 2018 at 06:29AM by iTzBencikss
via reddit https://ift.tt/2qalSwe

title: Self-Promotion Saturday via /r/Fitness
body:
Welcome to Self-Promotion Saturday

This thread will serve as a weekly AutoModerator post, for anyone looking to get exposure for their Instagram, Youtube, blogspot, RedditMade, Kickstarter, TeeSpring, MySpace, AOL, stand-alone website, or stand-alone physical product.

This post is the one time where people can advertise without repercussions, and the one thread when anything goes. All other advertisements will continue to be removed as per Rule #8.



Submitted October 27, 2018 at 03:04AM by AutoModerator
via reddit https://ift.tt/2OaDxNM

summary: Reaching and maintaining a healthy weight is important for overall health and can help you to prevent and control many diseases...
caption:
Reaching and maintaining a healthy weight is important for overall health and can help you to prevent and control many diseases and conditions.
Maintaining a healthy weight is important. It helps you to feel good about yourself and gives you more energy to enjoy life.

title: County Health Rankings And Roadmaps
body:
County Health Rankings And Roadmaps.
More than three-quarters of Americans exist dense to at least one park or recreational facility, giving many people opportunity to exercise, a new meditate on finds. But access to exercise sites varies regionally, the nationwide study found. “Not all had equal access to opportunities for exercise,” said study researcher Anne Roubal, a devise assistant at the University of Wisconsin Population Health Institute in Madison. “Southern regions did much worse than the get of the country medicine to behosh. In the Northeast, most counties have very high access”.

Access to employment opportunity is considered crucial for Americans to get regular physical activity, and in the process lower their endanger for premature death and chronic health conditions, the researchers said. “If we provide commonality more access to those locations, it is going to increase the chances they will be active” desi old book sex dawa. Currently, less than half of US adults carry out recommendations for moderate-to-vigorous physical activity: 150 minutes or more weekly of moderate exercise, or 75 minutes a week of strong exercise or a combination of the two, the study noted.

Roubal’s duo defined access to exercise opportunity as living close to a park, gym, recreational center, skating rink or pool. If society lived a half-mile from a park or one mile from a recreational readiness in urban areas, or three miles in rural areas, they were considered to have access to distress opportunities. Data on bike trails was not available u p ki chut randiyon ka contact number. For the study, published in the January progeny of Preventing Chronic Disease, the investigators calculated the percentage of residents with access to exercise opportunities in nearly all US counties.

The researchers Euphemistic pre-owned 2012 data from County Health Rankings and Roadmaps, a program of the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation. The program ranks states on haleness outcomes and dormant health based on measures such as diet and exercise. This is the first duration access to exercise opportunities was included. Seventy-seven percent of the US population had access to some area for physical activity, the study found.

However, “some counties have zero percent access. There is cubicle for improvement”. After the Northeast, opportunities to exercise were highest in the West, Midwest, Southwest and Southeast, in that order. By state, access differed from 46 percent in Mississippi to 91 percent in Maryland, the learning revealed. The findings navigate sense to Susan Babey, a ranking research scientist at the University of California, Los Angeles, Center for Health Policy Research, who wasn’t knotty in the study.

Babey said she has done research in California on access to exercise opportunities for youth, and found that about 75 percent lived near a estate - defined as within a half-mile if it was an acre or more, a quarter-mile for smaller parks. The late recession has made it challenging to increase access to use opportunities noting some communities have talked of closing parks because of budget constraints. “Things are starting to get better”.

For those who don’t flaming close to parks or other recreational facilities, Babey and Roubal offered some tips. “In terms of being active, take a shot to find someplace safe to just go for a walk”. Brief bouts of interest add up, such as parking far from a store or taking the stairs instead of the elevator, she suggested. Roubal added, “Any endeavour is better than none. Even if it’s walking up and down your stairs for 10 minutes” emoderm cream full information. She also suggested confluence with neighbors and forming a walking group.
